modules.description: This module offers set operations for ordered collections of `path` values, including addition, removal, combination, and element-wise transformations like mapping and filtering, alongside traversal and inspection methods. It supports safe and unsafe retrieval of specific elements, list-to-set conversions, and debugging utilities such as formatting and dumping. Use cases include managing hierarchical path data, efficient element querying, and structured data manipulation in systems requiring ordered set semantics.

This module offers key-based operations for manipulating maps, including adding, updating, removing, and merging bindings, along with transformations like filtering, mapping, and splitting. It works with maps where keys can be paths or generic types and values are either single elements or lists, enabling structured data handling. Use cases include safe retrieval of hierarchical data, dynamic configuration management, and efficient traversal of nested key-value relationships.

Processes and manipulates file system paths using POSIX or Windows conventions, supporting operations like joining, splitting, and normalizing paths. Works with string-based path representations and provides functions for path construction and transformation. Used to handle cross-platform path logic in build systems and file management tools.

Provides set and map operations for handling file system paths and associated data. It supports ordered set manipulations, such as adding, filtering, and transforming path collections, as well as key-based map operations for managing path or generic key-value pairs with flexible value structures. Users can perform efficient lookups, merges, and traversals, enabling tasks like configuration management and hierarchical data organization. Examples include filtering a set of paths by extension or building a map of directory paths to their contents.
